article:
This article lists notable people who were or have been diagnosed with
colorectal cancer.
* Claude Debussy, French composer http://w3.rz-
  berlin.mpg.de/cmp/debussy.html
* Audrey Hepburn died January 20,
  1993 [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/3667517.stm BBC]
* Babe Didrikson Zaharias, American
  athlete [http://espn.go.com/sportscentury/features/00014147.html
  ESPN]
* Bobby Moore, 1966 England World cup winning captain, died at age 51, 2 years
  after diagnosis.
* Carmen Marc Valvo, American Evening-wear designer [http://www.aarpsegundajuventud.org/english/health/2008-
  WIN/valvo.html AARP SegundaJuventud]
* Charles M. Schulz, creator of Peanuts, died at age 77; 60 days after diagnosi-
  s. [http://archives.cnn.com/2000/US/02/13/schulz.obit.02/index.html
  CNN]
* Corazon Aquino, 11th president of the Philippines who died 1 Aug 2009, aged
  76. http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/storypage.aspx?StoryID=112887
* Darryl Strawberry
* Eartha Kitt died December 25, 2008
* Ralph Klein (1931-2008), Israeli basketball player and coach
* Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother Developed colon cancer at age 66, died 2002
  aged 101 {http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/8259474.stm]
* Elizabeth Montgomery, American actress, died at age 62, 8 weeks after
  diagnosis. [http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0000548/ IMDB] [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/england/4559861.stm
  BBC]
* Harold Wilson, former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom [http://www.da-
  ilymail.co.uk/pages/live/femail/article.html?in_article_id=463794&in_page_id=-
  1766&ito=1490 Daily Mail]
* Jay Monahan, husband of news anchor Katie Couric, died of colon cancer in 1998
  at the age of 42; Couric became a spokesperson for colon cancer and an
  increase in screening rates is attributed to publicity generated by her. [http://www.usatoday.com/news/health/spotlighthealth/2004-06-23-
  couric_x.htm Katie Couric reports on colorectal cancer] at USA Today -
  Health.
* Joel Siegel, Emmy award winning film critic and Entertainment Editor of ABC's
  Good Morning America [http://articles.latimes.com/2007/jun/30/local/me-
  siegel30 LA Times]
* Pope John Paul II
* Lynn Faulds Wood, former BBC Watchdog presenter, survived advanced bowel
  cancer and founded the charities Beating Bowel Cancer and Lynn's Bowel Cancer
  Campaign. Lynn's Bowel Cancer Campaign|http://www.bowelcancer.tv/cgi-
  bin/page.pl?page=LynnsStory&accessability=no
* Malcolm Marshall, West Indian and Hampshire
  Cricketer [http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/sport/cricket/505421.stm BBC
  report]
* Neville Chamberlain, former British Prime Minister from 1937 to 1940. He died
  in 1941 just one year after he resigned as British Premier.
* Peggy Lipton
* Robin Gibb, singer, musician and producer, member of the Bee Gees.
* Rod Roddy - second announcer for The Price is Right, died on October 27, 2003,
  2 years after being diagnosed with colon cancer. [http://www.cbsnews.com/-
  stories/2003/10/27/entertainment/main580335.shtml 'Price Is Right's' Rod Roddy
  Dies] at CBS News
* Ronald Reagan [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/1156513.stm BBC]
* Simon MacCorkindale, actor; first diagnosed in 2006; died 14 October 2010.
* Sharon Osbourne, wife of Ozzy Osbourne, was diagnosed with colon cancer in
  2002. The cancer was spread to her lymph nodes, but she survived against a 33%
  survival prognosis.
* Chat Silayan (July 8, 1959 - April 23, 2006) was a Filipina beauty queen and
  actress. She won the 1980 Binibining Pilipinas Universe crown and became the
  third runner-up at Miss Universe 1980.
* Ted Sizer, education reformer, died in 2009 at age of 77
* Herman Cain, an American newspaper columnist, businessman, politician, and
  radio talk-show host from Georgia. He is best known as the former chairman and
  CEO of Godfather's Pizza and as a 2012 Republican U.S. Presidential candidate.
* Tony Snow, newscaster and former Press Secretary under President George W.
  Bush; died 12 July 2008 at the age of
  53. [http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,381250,00.html Fox News]
* Vince Lombardi (June 11, 1913-September 3, 1970), American football coach of
  Green Bay Packers and Washington Redskins. The Super Bowl trophy was renamed
  in his honor shortly after his death, as his Packers won the first two Super
  Bowls. [http://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=jvrRlaHg2sAC&dat=19700903&-
  printsec=frontpage&hl=en|title=Lombardi Dies Of Cancer Milwaukee Journal,
  Sept. 3, 1970, page 1]
* Bob Jenkins, Auto racing broadcaster {{cite news
| url =http://sportscouchpotato.typepad.com/sports_couch_potato/2009/03/versus-
| indycar-voice-jenkins-a-true-survivor.html title =Versus' IndyCar voice
| Jenkins true survivor publisher =Sports Couch Potato date = 2009-03-12
| accessdate = 2009-04-07}}
* Sid Waddell, darts commentator (10 August 1940 - 11 August 2012). Died 11
  months after diagnosis
  [http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/darts/15012394.stm BBC]
* Susan Oliver, American actress (February 13, 1932 - May 10, 1990)
* Jack Albertson, American actor (June 16, 1907 - November 25, 1981)
* Sorrell Booke, known for his role as the corrupt county commissioner "Boss
  Hogg" in The Dukes of Hazzard, which aired on CBS from 1979 to 1985. His 1994
  death caused him to be absent from the reunion movie in 1997. Booke's co-star
  Denver Pyle died soon after the release.
* Sam Simon, director, producer and philanthropist.
